title: Bringing my NordWave 2 from Norway to USA
post_content: When bringing my NOrdwave 2 from Norway to USA I know I have to switch the internal plug to 110VDo I also have to change the fuse? to 300mA? or Can I use 315mA?ThanksDag

title: RE: Bringing my NordWave 2 from Norway to USA
post_content: Hi and welcome to NUF. It's common courtesy to search a forum before posting. Your topic is already well discussed and does not need a new thread dedicated to it.In fact, there is a sticky post right here at the top of the entire thread list called "Converting Nords between European and North American Power":general-nord-forum-f29/converting-nords ... 23084.htmlThe answer to your question is in bold font there. It cannot be missed unless you are simply not reading.Can I use 315mA?No, you cannot use a 315mA fuse in place of a 300mA fuse. That's always a rule with fuses and is not specific to this case - use what the designer specified.

title: RE: Bringing my NordWave 2 from Norway to USA
post_content: Ok Thanks..Im not sure what to use..I know there is a 125 in it now (Norway)

title: RE: Bringing my NordWave 2 from Norway to USA
post_content: In that post I linked it tells you exactly which kind of fuse and what voltage, size, and amperage to put in your Nord. Should be everything you need to know! If there's 125 in there, and you want to be extra careful you can put a 250mA fuse in, but I wouldn't go over 300mA, definitely.With fuses, you can always try a lower amperage value, but you're more likely to blow it by accident. While you may get lucky and not damage anything with a too-large fuse, it's never a good idea to go higher than rated - the circuit may already be at the edge of tolerance there, so you run the risk of damaging something expensive in the unfortunate case of an internal short, a power surge, or other low-probability-but-high-damage-potential cases. Of course, they always say the circuit blows to protect the fuse... hehe.

title: Nord Wave software gone wild
post_content: Hi everyone, this is my first topic here.I've had some software issues with my Nord Wave after not using it for a few months, it's not functioning anymore. I've found some related topics on this forum (here,hereandhere), but none of them seems to have been solved... I have sent a message to the Nord Technical Support, hoping to get an answer.In case some of you might have a solution or ideafor me, I copied below the message that I sent to the Technical Support.Many thanks anyways !The message sent to technical support:Hello,I have contacted you earlier for a problem of factory restore stuck in progress. It seems that my problem was bigger than that. I have stopped the program while running (there was no other choice). Then I have made other tests that I describe below. My conclusion is that my Nord Wave is having software issues that are far beyond my abilities, and that the only way to have it working again would be to send it to a professional repair center. Here are the tests I made, anyway:- When I turn on the Nord Wave keyboard, it seems to have lost the OS update that I did before turning it off.- When turned on, the Nord Wave digital screen shows successively these three messages:1. "Nord WaveHwRev 1.0-2.0"2. "Nord WaveInvalid CAB hdr"3. "Update modeready"- Then, when I connect the Nord Wave to my MacBook Air through usb, and open the file "Update Nord Wave OS v2.14.dmg", I get this message: "Connected, but unable to get TP version and build.". I can however continue and press "Update", which runs successfully.- I can then open Nord Sound Manager. There, I see that "Samp Lib", "Program", and "SWave" are empty, except for two samples that I was able to download to the keyboard earlier.- With my first early try to do a full restore, I got stuck in the process, with estimated time going up with no limitation (it got up to more than 5000 minutes, after 4 or 5 hours running the restore…). Therefore, I tried to add factory samples one by one. I was able to add "FndJazzPlectrum_Direct_CLv4.nsmp", "FndJazz Finger_Dir _STv4.nsmp", "PersianSantur__ste PSv4.nsmp", "CathedralOrgan5__ste SRv4.nsmp", one by one, and then when I tried adding another sample "CathedralOrgan3__ste SRv4.nsmp", I got stuck again in the process. The estimated time showed on the Nord Sound Manager kept increasing starting at 2 minutes and then going to 3, 4, 5... 9, 10 minutes without stopping. Both the Nord Sound Manager and the Nord Wave digital panel were showing the message "Cleaning..." when this happened. When the estimated time reached 15 minutes and I was still stuck in progress, I decided to close Nord Sound Manager. When reopening, I found only two samples, one Fender Jazz Dir and one Persian Santur, and two other samples that were corrupted. I decided to erase them, but the Nord Sound Manager closed unexpectedly. When I reopened it, I had three valid samples and not two, plus one invalid sample that I could erase...- I decided to stop there with the Nord Sound Manager and disconnect the usb port. I could then see that my Nord Wave seemed to be working, although there were no program, no waves, AND no samples (while I thought I successfully added at least two). All the buttons and knobs seem to be functionning. I could play a little bit with some simple triangular or square oscillators + effects. However that is all my Nord Wave could do.- I tried to store a program on my Nord Wave, and the digital screen said:"Failed to store!Errore code: 12"- I turned my Nord Wave off. When turned on back again, it showed these messages:1. "Nord WaveHwRev 1.0-2.0"2. "Nord WaveInvalid OS"3. "Update modeready"I have now decided to stop my experiments. I hope that you can help me finding a skillful person who could restore my Nord Wave keyboard to the way it was, and that I'll have a wonderful time playing it again.Many thanks in advance for your help.Have a wonderful day,

title: Quality of Audio Connections
post_content: Hi Nord Wave Users,I have a Wave 2 and am hooking up in my small studio to my audio interface.  Is it preferable to use the L/R output jacks vs. the stereo headphone jack (would be broken out to L/R into the interface)?  Being that all connections out of the Wave 2 are unbalanced, I am unsure if there would be a difference in the quality of the audio signal.Second question: Is the external 3.5mm stereo input a reliable source for high quality audio?  I'm considering running an external synth but not sure if routing through the Wave 2's external in would result in perceivable poorer audio quality vs. routing directly to the audio interface.Again - my studio is small and I'm not running long cables.  My cables are coiled and running lengths of 6-10 ft max (my keyboard is on wheels).Thanks!

title: RE: Quality of Audio Connections
post_content: 1.  The L/R outs are designed to be routed to the interface, mixer, etc.  Being unbalanced has not effect on the sound quality.  The headphone jack is designed for headphones.  Get some quality cables and run them to your interface.2. Again, if you have inputs in your audio interface, use them for the external synth rather than the 3.5mm input connection.-dj

title: RE: Quality of Audio Connections
post_content: The cross talk between channels is likely better out of the discrete left right outputs but that is the main issue I can think of and it is likely not a deal killer.

title: RE: Quality of Audio Connections
post_content: From a purely practical standpoint, you should be fine either way.  Other factors [room EM interference, gain staging, dodgy cables, etc.] are more likely to be an issue.

title: Layer sliders—cracked plastic?
post_content: Hey everybody! Worst case scenario is i'll have to go via the warranty route, which seems tedious.Be careful with your sliders! Anyone else have this problem yet?

title: RE: Layer sliders—cracked plastic?

title: RE: Layer sliders—cracked plastic?
post_content: Have Nord addressed this Issue,so that newer Waves don't have any dodgy slider caps?Have Nord confirmed its a dodgy Batch of sliders???After seeing how Nord put their Keyboards through a Heat test as part of the Quality control (essentially baking the Keyboards)I wonder if this is what is causing the Plastic caps to split??The sliders are a different material to the usual rubberised Knobs that Nord use and perhaps a substantially cheaper Plastic compound than the usual nord push buttons,so perhaps the Heat test is causing them to split or maybe they are Just cheap Chinese imports??I'm looking to purchase a Nw2 but am a little put off by this unless Nord have addressed the issue,I know they can be replaced but its not the usual Nord Quality that I'm used to so am becoming a bit sceptical seeing as people have also been having issues with their Stage 3s as well,And a guy I know who works in a Musical instruments retailer has told me that some people have had issues with the OLED displays on the Wave 2 also, as he's had 2 people had to have theirs repaired,!!Is nords Quality control standards slipping,or are they using cheaper components to keep costs down??I've never had any issues with my Nord Keyboards but seeing the problems people have been having with the last two Newer Generation Nord Keyboard releases is not filling me with confidence in future purchases!

title: Mono/legato note priority on Wave 2
post_content: I wanted to see what the Stage 4 offered before making a decision, but for some time I've been thinking of moving up to the Wave 2 after owning an A1 for several years, as it seems to check almost all the boxes of what I'm looking for in a synth.One feature the Stage 4 offers is the low/high note priority options in mono mode, which I would use a lot for layers (chord on one layer, monophonic bass or lead on the other). There are dedicated LEDs for this on the Stage 4 but it seems this could conceivably be added to the Wave 2 as a SHIFT function as it's the same synth engine (even if the only visual feedback might be on an OLED display).I know this can be roughly accomplished by carefully playing chord tones in the right order, but to make things easier I'd love to see this on the NW2.

title: Nord Wave  2 midi channels
post_content: I am a bit confused about the midi implementation on the Nord Wave 2.I want to have 1 layer (on a dedicated channel) controlling an external module. Is this possible? On page 29 it says it doesn't send midi out from different layers, but on page 32 it looks like it does.

title: RE: Nord Wave  2 midi channels
post_content: Ah, it looks like it does, explained on page 30. However, I see I can't sent program changes in this mode.... That's a bit of a drawback.And also, what does “ In this scenario a store operation needs to be performed for the settings to be recalled when the program is loaded again.” mean? You can’t really save the midi channel settings?Sorry for the multiple posts.

title: RE: Nord Wave  2 midi channels
post_content: Hi from my understanding the midi channel you set is receive only. So basically you get a four channel multitimbral sound unit, driven by an external source.

title: RE: Nord Wave  2 midi channels
post_content: So on load of programme it would set each layer to its assigned midi channel.

title: RE: Nord Wave  2 midi channels
post_content: Thank you for the reply.As I now understand. You can set every layer on a different midi channel, but this setting is not stored. So the wave makes it impossible to make patches on which sometimes I control an external module (live). I should assign the channels manually for each patch every time, which doesn’t work live.Too bad.

title: RE: Nord Wave  2 midi channels
post_content: According to the manual, the setting per layer (send and receive) is stored if the Global channel is set to Off:When a Global MIDI channel is set, i.e. not set to Off, this page definesthe receiving MIDI channels for Layers A/B/C/D.When the Global MIDI channel is set to Off, the channels defined on thispage will both send and receive MIDI, and are stored per-program. Inthis scenario a Store operation needs to be performed for the settings tobe recalled when the program is loaded again.I never use this, so I haven't tested it.  I control the W2 from my NS3 Extern section which is designed more for a master keyboard function.-dj

title: RE: Nord Wave  2 midi channels
post_content: I did some testing of the MIDI on the Wave 2, to see how it could work with a Stage 3.  What I ideally wanted was to be able to use the Stage 3 keyboard to control some Wave 2 layers via MIDI, and the Wave 2's own keyboard to control others, but it doesn't look like that's currently possible.If the Global Channel is set to OFF, then each layer can receive on its own MIDI channel, and the channel for each layer is stored per program. Unfortunately, there are 2 huge shortcomings with this mode:1.  Each layer must have a different MIDI channel - you can't have multiple layers respond to the same MIDI channel. If 2 or more layers have the same MIDI channel, then only the lowest layer sounds. For example, if I set Layer A and Layer B to MIDI channel 8, then only Layer A responds to MIDI data on channel 8. There is a hint on the display, because the MIDI channel for Layer B appears in brackets as (8).2. Program Change messages are only received on the Global Channel, so you can't change the Wave 2 program from the Stage 3 in this mode.If the Global Channel is set to a value, then each layer can still receive its own MIDI channel, but the channels for each layer are now global (i.e. they can't be changed with different programs). The Wave 2 also responds to Program Change and MIDI data on the Global Channel, and this plays all the layers which are active (i.e. the same as if you were playing the Wave 2's own keyboard).This means if you want to play some layers on the Wave 2 from an external keyboard especially the Stage 3, the options are very limited.  You can basically either play only the active layers on the Wave 2 global channel, or play only one layer from the Stage 3 and the other 3 layers from the Wave 2's keyboard.It would be great if either:- Multiple layers on the Wave 2 could receive MIDI data on the same layer channel, and / or- The Wave 2 could respond to program changes on one of the layer MIDI channels.  Then you could at least use both Stage 3 external sections to control 2 layers on the Wave 2 from the Stage 3.- The MIDI channel for each layer was always stored per program regardless of Global Channel setting.There's maybe a bit more flexibility if you use splits on either the Wave 2 or Stage 3 external section to divide up the keyboard. Anything more complex than this is going to need some kind of MIDI processor (rechannelizer?) to turn one channel output from the Stage 3 external section to 4 channels in parallel to operate different layers of the Wave 2.

title: RE: Nord Wave  2 midi channels
post_content: Quick Update:  Getting some good results with Nord Stage 3 controlling Wave 2 via an iPad running Midiflow and a USB hub to link the iPad, Stage 3 and Wave 2. The basic config I have in Midiflow takes one external section of the Stage 3 as an input, and generates the following MIDI outputs:- The Wave 2 Global channel, but with note data removed, to send program change, sustain pedal and mod wheel as necessary.- Note data is duplicated to as many of the Wave 2 individual layer channels as I need.I didn't really want an extra piece of gear to carry around and set-up, but actually Midiflow works really well to link the Stage 3 to Wave 2.  I can also add my Roli Lightpad Block as a pad controller for triggering chords etc, as this is really small and sits on the Stage 3 compact nicely.  Thinking of maybe swapping the iPad for a Blokas Midihub in the future when more become available.

title: RE: Nord Wave  2 midi channels
post_content: Hi-I have the same two instruments, and have Midi out of NS3 to Midi in of NW2. I send program changes directly to the Wave 2, only sending notes on programs when necessary to sound both keyboards at once.  I am not using any other gear, like you do in your setup.  Is there an advantage to having the iPad in the mix?-dj

title: RE: Nord Wave  2 midi channels
post_content: DJKeys wrote:Hi-I have the same two instruments, and have Midi out of NS3 to Midi in of NW2. I send program changes directly to the Wave 2, only sending notes on programs when necessary to sound both keyboards at once.  I am not using any other gear, like you do in your setup.  Is there an advantage to having the iPad in the mix?-djIt's possible to play the Wave 2 from the Stage 3 on the global channel, but it's limited to only playing the active layers, plus one other layer.  If, for example you wanted to play 2 of the Wave 2 layers from the Stage 3 and the other 2 from the Wave 2's own keyboard (or 3 and 1), then you can't do that.  The MIDI processing in the iPad means you can play any combination of the 4 Wave 2 layers or the 2 Stage 3 panels from either keyboard.

title: Deactivate Mod Wheel Midi Send?
post_content: Hi,i am totally new to synths and I have my first gig as a keyboarder (normally I play bass) in one week.What am I trying to do?I want to play my nordwave 2 in combination with my Roland vt4 vocoder, so paying and singing a vocoder vocals as background vocals at the same time.It works just fine, however, when I move the mod wheel of my Nord, for example to open up the filter of the patch, my vocoder voice changes too. There is a tremolo like effect going on on the voice.So the mod wheel sends midi data to my Roland vt4 and triggers, blends in an effect that I don't want.Is there a possibility to tell the Nord, to not send midi data from the mod wheel.(I can't disable the tremolo effect an the Roland ...maybe there is a possibility, but the manual doesn't help)Thanks everyone!Johnny from Bavaria

title: RE: Deactivate Mod Wheel Midi Send?
post_content: In the Midi Menu (Shift + Program 3), you need to set CC Mode to either Off or Receive.

title: RE: Deactivate Mod Wheel Midi Send?
post_content: Thank you but this doesnt help. I dont know why because it seems obvious that if it doesnt send midi cc it shouldnt trigger the vt4 effectsAlso tried that before.Any other solutions?

title: RE: Deactivate Mod Wheel Midi Send?
post_content: Might it helps if you check the midi out with a midi tool like midiox. It's for free and it shows you the midioutput of your Nord.

title: RE: Deactivate Mod Wheel Midi Send?
post_content: Thanks.But  how does this help? You mean i will know what midi data my nordwave is sending?

title: RE: Deactivate Mod Wheel Midi Send?
post_content: Yes, perhaps a way to solve the problem.

title: RE: Deactivate Mod Wheel Midi Send?
post_content: Wirh a midi filter or how can i do that?

title: RE: Deactivate Mod Wheel Midi Send?
post_content: JohnnyZombie wrote:Thanks.But  how does this help? You mean i will know what midi data my nordwave is sending?Exactly, disabling the CC send should prevent the MW data (MIDI CC#11) to be sent, so if there is still something happening either the setting on NW is not correct or there are other MIDI data that affect the vocoder.Step 1 in these cases is: diagnose the problem using a MIDI Monitor (MidiOX on Windows, Snoize MIDI Monitor on Mac,..) , then you'll be able to evaluate the next step.PS: on NW2 the setting for MIDI CC Mode affects only the Global channel, if you are also using individual Layer channels that setting won't work.So, for the usage with the Vocoder, check/ensure you are using only the Global channel (Layer channels = Off or anyway different from the one set for Global/Vocoder and also ensure that the Vocoder MIDI Channel is not set to Omni (0), but to the specific 1–16 Ch (matching the NW2 Global )

title: RE: Deactivate Mod Wheel Midi Send?
post_content: The manual isn't very clear about the two fundamentally different MIDI operating types:As long as Global MIDI is On, commands will only be sent on the global MIDI channel. But if it's off, MIDI commands are sent through the 4 layer channels. No idea if CC = off will work in both cases.P.30 ('Sending on layer channels') contradicts the table on p. 29 of the English manual saying that the layer channels only receive MIDI data.

title: RE: Deactivate Mod Wheel Midi Send?
post_content: FZiegler wrote:The manual isn't very clear about the two fundamentally different MIDI operating types:As long as Global MIDI is On, commands will only be sent on the global MIDI channel. But if it's off, MIDI commands are sent through the 4 layer channels. No idea if CC = off will work in both cases.P.30 ('Sending on layer channels') contradicts the table on p. 29 of the English manual saying that the layer channels only receive MIDI data.Correct, not so clear the way it is written there, but ultimately the best thing in the case of the OP would be to switch OFF all Layer channels and use only the Global, with MIDI CC Mode = Off. A check with a MIDI Monitor would confirm that in this way only Notes messages are actually sent to MIDI OUT/Vocoder.

title: RE: Deactivate Mod Wheel Midi Send?
post_content: JohnnyZombie wrote:Ok, I connected my nordwave via midi to my Mac and am running midi monitor software.Pretty easy.Global midi channel activeSending almost no data (only notes I am playing)BUT still sending though midi cc send is set to "off" the following:- 19:36:57.535	From mio	Control	4	Modulation Wheel (coarse)	1   (that's my main problem)- 19:37:49.817	From mio	Control	4	Bank Select	0 (bank select buttons)- morph button- pitch wheelYes those are the only knobs that still send data when send cc ist deactivated.Ok what can I do now, pleaseI forgot to ask: of course you have the latest OS on your NW2, right?If so and if also taxman's test will confirm this behaviour, then imho it is a bug to be submitted to Nord support for fixing.PS: talking about MW only, as Pitch Bend has a separate setting in MIDI menu, as well as Program Change whose setting should include also the Bank Select CCs (0 and 32).

title: RE: Deactivate Mod Wheel Midi Send?

title: RE: Deactivate Mod Wheel Midi Send?
post_content: There used to be a bug in this respect: CCs and PCs were all sent and received regardless of the settings, and this bug affected almost the whole latest generation of boards (S3, W2, E6...). It has been solved with a recent update (a year ago I think).Apparently not every CCs were addressed by the bug fix...

title: RE: Deactivate Mod Wheel Midi Send?
post_content: Hlaalu wrote:There used to be a bug in this respect: CCs and PCs were all sent and received regardless of the settings, and this bug affected almost the whole latest generation of boards (S3, W2, E6...). It has been solved with a recent update (a year ago I think).BUT mod wheel, pitch wheel and the sort of controls you describe aren't strictly CCs in MIDI language, so I am afraid that Nord fixed the bug only strictly for CCs and PCs but let the Global channel to send and receive everything else.By the way, it might be the case that Panel MIDI works differently. Back then, when the original bug was there, this was the reason I never used Global MIDI but Panel MIDI instead.I am sorry but I have to disagree HlaaluModWheel is definitely a CC (CC #1) by definition in the MIDI Standard and since the v1.0 of the MIDI Specifications

title: RE: Deactivate Mod Wheel Midi Send?
post_content: I'd prefer not to start discussing this because Clavia handles some basic MIDI CCs in a special way: They aren't mentioned in the CC list but are supported. This doesn't concern Sustain (#64) or Ctrl pedal (#11), but always ModWheel (#1) as far as I can see. So, in the eyes of Clavia, it doesn't seem to be handled as standard CC though it surely is.

title: RE: Deactivate Mod Wheel Midi Send?
post_content: FZiegler wrote:I'd prefer not to start discussing this because Clavia handles some basic MIDI CCs in a special way: They aren't mentioned in the CC list but are supported. This doesn't concern Sustain (#64) or Ctrl pedal (#11), but always ModWheel (#1) as far as I can see. So, in the eyes of Clavia, it doesn't seem to be handled as standard CC though it surely is.Agree, I don't want to enter in that type of discussion too, but then at least they (Clavia) should make it more clear on the manuals (and possibly explain why MW/CC1 is excluded from the filter), so I am still convinced that at the moment, based on what the NW2 manual says, the fact that CC#1 is still being sent even when CONTROL CHANGE is set to Off/Receive in MIDI menu is a bug

Without the midi filter it works.Tried cables and so on.Seems like my Roland vt4 vocoder can't handle the signals that are coming from the midi tech midi filter, even when the midi filter is on "thru" mode.Now I am so close and still it doesn't work.Could be due to the fact that the Miditech Thru/Filter is powered by the MIDI IN (so by the NW2) with a voltage lower than nominal, so the resulting OUT voltage is too low for the Vt4 (while still OK for your computer MIDI interface, apparently), it can happen with some devices, which is btw why MIDI Solutions also sells thishttps://midisolutions.com/prodpwr.htm(basically a powered MIDI Thru)

title: RE: Deactivate Mod Wheel Midi Send?
post_content: JohnnyZombie wrote:Thank you all.Well than when they are not treated as cc a cc filter wont help i think.I will have to by a more advanced midi filter were i can determine the exact midi data i want to filter.I'm not sure I follow: they aren't "treated" as CC in the sense that they are apparently not filtered by the onboard settings (decision/bug by Clavia), but this doesn't mean that CC#1 is a different kind of MIDI event than all the others. Any "normal" MIDI filter should work.In other words, the bug is that CC#1 is still sent/received when it isn't supposed to, not that ModWheel isn't a CC on Nord keyboards.

title: RE: Deactivate Mod Wheel Midi Send?
post_content: It may possibly have something to do with powering.How is your filter powered? Does it have its own plug? Or is it powered over MIDI? Which may be a problem as the current Nords only provide 3.3 V on MIDI (according to an additional MIDI specification from 2015) which is less than the 5 V older MIDI gear is expecting.The only thing I'm wondering about is that the MIDI signal should always be powered from the MIDI-out port. So nothing should change for the filter if you put a computer interface or another keyboard on the MIDI-in side.

title: RE: Deactivate Mod Wheel Midi Send?

title: RE: Nord Wave 2 Issues…
post_content: Nord Lead 2 / Nord Wave 2? What's your gear?To switch Local Off only means to disable the internal sound processing unit. This shouldn't have anything to do with MIDI. You may disable MIDI CC send instead so that only Program Change and notes are sent.Have you tried to use a MIDI viewer on your computer to see which MIDI data is sent when using the expression pedal? It may be #11 (expression) or #7 (volume). Only then you know what to filter out individually.

title: NW2 Program change Bank issue
post_content: Hello all!I want to load a program on my NW2 (OS 1.2 up to date) from the extern section of my NS2. In the extern section (ON of course), I set correctly midi channel to NW2 global midi channel, CC00 (MSB) to 0 and CC32(LSB) to 3 to access bank N (manual states NW2 should respond to LSB 0 for banks A-E, LSB 1 for banks F-J, LSB 3 for banks K-O) and a PC.But NW2 keeps ignoring LSB, loading the corresponding program, but in the A-E banks. PC is responding, just not CC32.I've seem similar issues in this forum with Nord waves 2 Any suggestion ?

title: RE: NW2 Program change Bank issue
post_content: Hi-Turn the Global midi channel off on the NS2 and set the Extern section to Per Program and set the channel there same as Global channel on NW2.  Then set the MSB and LSB in page 7 of the Extern settings. Make sure Send on Load is enabled. This should trigger the correct banks. I just tested this on my NS3>NW2 and it works as it should--dj

title: RE: Problem with Midi Clock Sync on Wave2
post_content: Hi-There may always be midi sync issues when using multiple pieces of gear.  Both mkastrup and Rcmusic report no problems. title: Possibility of Additional Sample RAM Being Able To Be Added?
post_content: I wonder if there is / will be, the ability to have a modification done to the Nord Wave 2 to allow the addition of more than 1GB of internal sample memory...As memory is so cheap these days, it seems surprising that this instrument that allows sample import, only gives you 1GB.Just think what would be possible if you could add up a 1TB of sample RAM. It would be amazing.Thoughts?

title: RE: Possibility of Additional Sample RAM Being Able To Be Added?
post_content: Not possibile and the RAM used on Nord Wave is not the same as the one for computers, it is fast SRAM (or Flash RAM) specific for the DSP architecture used by Nord (as discussed in other similar threads also in the past) and is soldered on the mainboard.

title: RE: Possibility of Additional Sample RAM Being Able To Be Added?
post_content: The memory is actually, in a way, a lot more than 1GB due to Nord's audio compression. It's closer to 2.5 or 3 GB. Yes, I get your point, it's still small compared to a computer, phone, etc. When we have other hardware like the Prophet X with a 200GB SSD, people installing multi hundred GB SSD's into their Kronos (or so  I heard,) and even a drum module that can have up to 64 GB of samples streamable from an SSD card in real time (2Box DrumIt,) it's about time that this changes. But honestly unless Nord allowed for multiple velocity layers in the sample format and/or opened up the .npno format for users I can't see how having a vastly larger memory size would matter much at present.Bottom line is it would be great but it won't happen.

title: Filter turns off
post_content: Hello, guys.When I change sample (sample mode) in my nord wave 2 filter turn off. This happens every time the sample is changed. This is bug?

title: RE: Filter turns off
post_content: Hey, Andy-This is by design.  The samples are pre-processed and don't use the onboard filter.  This happens with all the samples.  You can turn the filter on, of course, and adjust it to your liking, but the default samples will always turn off the filter--dj

title: RE: Filter turns off
post_content: I think I understand what Andy means. The filter should only be turned of when switching to "raw sample", but after rotating through the options, the filter gets generally turned of, even if I leave "raw sample". Strangely, if I rotate to "raw sample" again after the filter has turned itself off, on this position a new filter setting is turned on agin. It really gets confusing because the SAMPLE LEDs seem to loose their correspondency after circling through the functions, only skip attack works right.

title: RE: Filter turns off
post_content: Also the Amp Env seems to get reset when loading a different sample, e.g. release time.

title: RE: Filter turns off
post_content: Zeitfraktur wrote:Also the Amp Env seems to get reset when loading a different sample, e.g. release time.Any time a new sample is loaded, the built in settings (amp, filter) are initiated.-dj

post_content: AFAIR I was switching between two of my user created samples. Not sure if those contain any of such built in settings at all?

title: RE: Filter turns off
post_content: Interesting point.  I am not sure how the instrument behaves in this case, will have to do some testing of my own.  My guess is that any loaded sample will turn the filter off, regardless if it has pre programmed settings like the factory samples from Nord.-dj

title: RE: Filter turns off
post_content: Sounds like the normal behavior to me, as stated above the default is that the filter and amp have pre-programmed settings when loading a sample. You can adjust the amp as you like, and you can turn on the filter as well, it's just an extra button press

title: RE: Filter turns off
post_content: This is not a normal behaviour. If you leave "raw sample" or rotate through the sample oscillator settings, the filter should be turned on again.

title: NW2  Lfo - no kb sync?
post_content: On the stage 3 the lfo has both clock sync - and kb sync so that it would start its cycle on each key press. Critical if you want to make rhythmic sounds with elements synced to each other.I see the NW2 is missing this feature and the lfo is free running? Unless i'm overlooking something?

title: RE: NW2  Lfo - no kb sync?
post_content: When you sync the LFO to the Master Clock, you can set the keyboard sync to soft or hard.  When I did this, the LFO was triggered when I hit the key. This is exactly the same mechanism as on the Stage 3.  The dedicated KB Sync button below the LFO section on the Stage 3 is for the Arpeggiator, not the LFO.-dj

title: RE: NW2  Lfo - no kb sync?
post_content: DJKeys wrote:When you sync the LFO to the Master Clock, you can set the keyboard sync to soft or hard.  When I did this, the LFO was triggered when I hit the key. This is exactly the same mechanism as on the Stage 3.  The dedicated KB Sync button below the LFO section on the Stage 3 is for the Arpeggiator, not the LFO.I'm not able to reproduce the part of your reply where you suggest, "When you sync the LFO to the Master Clock, you can set the keyboard sync to soft or hard"Here's what I'm doing:#0. I'm on the latest OS, 1.20.#1. Loaded up an <empty> preset.#2. Held down the MST CLK button and selected my preferred KBS mode, Hard. Clock Rate is default 120 bpm with no external clock involved.#3. Held down SHIFT and rotated the LFO RATE knob fully clockwise. Display reads "LFO MstClk ON" and the MST CLK light is illuminated.#4. I left the RATE knob alone, which is default at 4/1 (i.e. fully counter-clockwise) and left the default LFO waveform at Triangle.#5. Selected OSC PITCH for the LFO destination#6. Turned the AMOUNT knob to ~6, or 12.0 semitones#7. Played some staccato notesAt this point, it's clear that the LFO is still free-running and not triggered when I hit the key and I do not see an option to establish LFO keyboard sync as you suggest. The only spot on the panel for KB SYNC is in the ARPEGGIATOR / GATE section and just as you suggest for the Stage 3, enabling KB SYNC in the ARP section doesn't help.What am I missing? Thanks!Edit: FOUND IT!#8. Held down SHIFT and rotated the ARPEGGIATOR / GATE TEMPO knob fully counter-clockwise which (obviously) syncs the ARP TEMPO to MST CLK.What?! The ARP section is not even turned on, which doesn't make sense, but at least I found the secret path to a KB SYNC'ed LFO!

title: RE: NW2  Lfo - no kb sync?

title: RE: Brand new Nord Wave 2 has one key stuck

title: RE: Brand new Nord Wave 2 has one key stuck
post_content: HiI got a wave 2 in sep 2022 and had the same problem. 2 keys were really stickyI’m in Canada and waited 3 months for delivery and had to programme a show, so decided to fix it myself rather than send backAs far as I can tell it’s a fatar manufacture issue that’s not been picked up by nord quality controlThere were sharp bits of plastic down the sides of the key “runners” that guide the key over the lubricated rubbed bushings. I took a sharp craft knife and removed them on the 2 sticky keys and now it’s fineI was disappointed that this was missed at nord… but also glad it was fixableHope yours worked out

It would be very useful if they added that value in paranthesis.

title: Wave 2: Morph Velocity to Layer A to D: How?
post_content: Hi there,sometimes i need a good Bösendorfer imperial Samples here for my theater-work and the nord wave 2 has to do that. Unfortunately the nord wavew can not read the Piano LibrarySo i sampled my nord6D with the Bösendorfer with velocity 48, 80, 105 and 125 and put it via the sound sample editor into the nord and pointed them to the layers A to D.Now i have to tell the nord, that he has to use Layer A for all velocities from 0 - 48 and Layer B for velocities from 49 - 80, and Layer C for velocities from 81 - 105 and Layer D for velocities from 106 to 127.But how?I looked through the manual several times but i didn't get it.Are you so kind to help?Thanks in advance!Pit

title: RE: Wave 2: Morph Velocity to Layer A to D: How?
post_content: Hi, There-I experimented with this (extensive trial and error) and I don't believe there is a way to accomplish a smooth transitions between velocities. You are attempting to do velocity switching by the numbers which is not supported on any Nord instrument that I know.  I think you would get better results just importing the loudest sample and using velocity to control the amp and filter. The Wave 2 was not designed like the Electro or Stage series for serious classical piano playing.-dj

title: RE: Wave 2: Morph Velocity to Layer A to D: How?
post_content: Waking this for an additional question regarding velocity switching.It seems to me there's velocity switching performed in some factory samples, like pianos. Is there no way to set that in Nord Sample Editor for your own samples?

title: RE: Wave 2: Morph Velocity to Layer A to D: How?
post_content: All of the factory samples in the Wave 2 are loaded into a single layer.  There is amp and filter velocity programmed into most of them, but in a single layer.  Do you mean factory program? can you give an example of the factory sample you refer to?-dj

title: RE: Wave 2: Morph Velocity to Layer A to D: How?
post_content: OK, that's sureley the case. I though I heard velocity switching in some piano samples but it might as well be filter settings.If I understand correctly the Nord Pianos do have velocity switching? Is this something that's editable for the users when working with their own samples?

title: RE: Wave 2: Morph Velocity to Layer A to D: How?
post_content: There really isn't any programmable velocity switching, as all of the user samples would be single layer.  The Nord Pianos read the Piano library, so those pianos will give you what you want, but not with user samples--dj

title: RE: Wave 2: Morph Velocity to Layer A to D: How?
post_content: OK, thanks for the info. I guess the Nord Waves and Pianos aren't full blown samplers in the "traditional" way. Just wanted to make sure I didn't miss anything.

title: Sending 1 Midi Track to all 4 Layers in Wave 2
post_content: Hi GroupI have a Question regarding the Nord Wave 2Is it Possible to send a midi Sequence from my DAW and trigger all 4 Layers?If i choose the same Midi Chanel for all Layers in the Midi Settings, it doesnt seem to work.Am i missing something?I basically want to play with one Midi Track, all 4 Layers to create a complex Pad Sound.Thanx in advanceKevin

title: RE: Sending 1 Midi Track to all 4 Layers in Wave 2
post_content: Hi Kevin and welcome on this forum!I don't own a Nord Wave 2 but I had a look at theNord Wave 2 manual.The only interesting thing that I can find about the midi settings is the Global MIDI settings and Layer MIDI settings:GLOBAL MIDI CHANNELBy using the Global MIDI Channel, all MIDI notes and Control Change messages can be transmitted and/or received on a single MIDI channel. MIDI that enters the Nord Wave 2 on the Global MIDI channel will play all the Layers that are active.LAYER MIDI CHANNELSUse the individual Layer MIDI channels on the Nord Wave 2 for individual control of each Layer, both for notes and for panel parameters. Thiscan for example be used in a multitimbral setup, controlling 4 individual sound sources from a sequencer.(A Layer does not have to be active in a Program to receive MIDI, it will always respond to incoming MIDI on its MIDI Channel. This makes it possible to control selected Layers from the keyboard, and other Layers from other external sources.)The Layer channels can also be used for sending MIDI, when the Global MIDI channel is set to Off. See page 32 for information on how tomake these settings.On my Nord Stage 2 I can select if I send/receive on the MIDI DIN ports or on the MIDI USB port. Not sure if that is applicable for the NW2 as well.So I guess you can use the Global MIDI for receiving the midi file information from your DAW.Do you see the midi led blinking on your NW2 when your DAW is playing/sending the midi file?

title: RE: Sending 1 Midi Track to all 4 Layers in Wave 2
post_content: Yes, using the Global channel for Midi should allow all layers to be triggered simultaneously on that channel.-dj

title: RE: Sending 1 Midi Track to all 4 Layers in Wave 2
post_content: YeeeessssssssThe Global Midi Channel solved that!I havent thought about that option at all.Thank you everybody for the support,i really appreciate it.Have a great day.

title: Oscillator question - A1 and Wave 2
post_content: After years of being inspired by the Nord A1 and how easy it is to come up with great sounds, I was wondering if upgrading to a Wave 2 would be worthwhile.One thing I like to use on the A1 is the osc combinations like saw + triangle or saw + one of the sine harmonics, and sometimes use osc ctrl to morph between different balances of the two. Looking at the Wave 2 manual, it didn’t look like it had these kinds of combinations? It listed things like Dual Saw and Dual Saw 5th+ so  it might be simplified in this regard?

title: RE: Oscillator question - A1 and Wave 2
post_content: I just played the Wave 2 in a music store 1 hour ago. Sold my Lead A1 two weeks ago. I'm not planning to upgrade myself. I was trying out guitar amp heads.If you upgrade, you will no doubt lose some of the immediacy of the A1. Essentially every part of the synth is upgraded (more complicated) to some extent. Although for example filter drive is far more tame om the W2.There seem to be less options the way you described it, but I would say it is far from "simplified". I guess you mean "less options", which is arguably the same thing.The only reasons I would upgrade are sample playback, and (more significantly) the keybed. I already own a Stage 3, so sample playback is covered, but the W2 keybed i infernally better than the one on Lead A1.If I could have the W2 keybed on the Lead A1, I would probably still own it.

title: RE: Oscillator question - A1 and Wave 2
post_content: I did upgrade from the A1 to the W2 in 2020. I found it is super easy to program any sound on it, including complex multi-patches.  I don't find the Osc selection limited at all, and the Poly(Chord)/Gate ability of the Arpeggiator (Like the Virus TI2) is worth the price of admission for my use. Side by side, it took me only a few days to duplicated all of my A1 patches on the W2, and there were about 70 of them--dj

title: RE: Oscillator question - A1 and Wave 2
post_content: I upgraded from L2X & A1 & A4 and is very happy! Less stuff, more possibilities IMHO.

title: RE: Oscillator question - A1 and Wave 2
post_content: Thanks for the replies! So just to verify, are there any multi-oscillator settings that allow waveforms of two different types at the same time in one program, like saw+triangle, or saw+sine (without needing to use different layers)?

title: RE: Oscillator question - A1 and Wave 2
post_content: robmartino wrote:Thanks for the replies! So just to verify, are there any multi-oscillator settings that allow waveforms of two different types at the same time in one program, like saw+triangle, or saw+sine (without needing to use different layers)?The complete description of waveforms is listed starting on page 20 of the manual.  All of the waveforms beside the Basic set allow continuously variable sound modulation via the Osc Control knob.https://www.nordkeyboards.com/sites/def ... on%20G.pdf-dj

title: RE: Oscillator question - A1 and Wave 2
post_content: Yup, I was looking at that part of the manual but didn’t see any examples of multi oscillators with two different types, just this reference to “a large number of simultaneously sounding oscillators”:Super Saw, Super Square, Super Bright, Super Organ: a large number of simulatenously sounding oscillators, producing a very rich and full sound. The stereo width is increased in Unison mode.

title: RE: Oscillator question - A1 and Wave 2
post_content: I wish the wave 2 had this feature, like the stage 3.  On the stage 3 you can mix two different oscillators and adjust the amount of each on a single panel.  For instance, you can mix a saw wave with a square oscillator set an octave lower at a 60/40 mix.  Very handy to do a simple bass on one panel.  The wave 2 can achieve the same effect using 2 layers but having the oscillator blend function like the a1 and stage 3 would be more efficient, I think.

title: RE: Oscillator question - A1 and Wave 2
post_content: The Stage 3 synth was modeled after the A1 synth.  The W2 is unique it its own, and you can get very good sounds from one layer.-dj

title: RE: Oscillator question - A1 and Wave 2
post_content: robmartino wrote:Thanks for the replies! So just to verify, are there any multi-oscillator settings that allow waveforms of two different types at the same time in one program, like saw+triangle, or saw+sine (without needing to use different layers)?You can morph some waveforms, mostly sine to various others (sine/saw for example,) but not mix 2 different waveforms on one layer. That would require 2 layers to accomplish. Given that the layer sliders are right there, it's easy enough to set this up, I don't really think it's any less immediate and you can still use the morph groups to control it as well.

title: Wave 2 Sample Editor
post_content: Two questions / suggestions:- Is it possible to set the root note for a sample outside of it's key range? Sometimes the best sounds occur when your sample's root is an octave higher than it's key range (thus playing back an octave lower).- I was surprised not to find a way to pan a sample to a position in the stereo field. Is there a way to do this? If not, there should be!thanks,brian

title: RE: Wave 2 Sample Editor
post_content: Aperus wrote:Two questions / suggestions:- Is it possible to set the root note for a sample outside of it's key range? Sometimes the best sounds occur when your sample's root is an octave higher than it's key range (thus playing back an octave lower).- I was surprised not to find a way to pan a sample to a position in the stereo field. Is there a way to do this? If not, there should be!thanks,brianNot sure about the first question, but regarding the second I'd work at original sample level (.wav); use a software like Audacity (for example) or a DAW and transform it to stereo (if original is mono) then do the panning on it to generate a new .wav with the expected panning.

title: RE: Wave 2 Sample Editor
post_content: Aperus wrote:DJKeys wrote:I guess he meant how to make a per-note (or per sampled wave, in a sampleset) panning, for example what you do when creating a drumkit... but I may be wrong.Yes, I was wondering if when creating a sample file with multiple samples (like a drumkit), is it possible to pan each sample in the Sample Editor. I saw the comment about doing the panning in your audio editor first. Yes, that is one solution, though more time consuming. I can't imagine it's possible to pan individual samples once they are moved over to the keyboard, unless its composed of only a single sample?You have to consider that the sample playback capability on Nord keyboards (since the first Nord Wave) and related  .nsmp format were originallu meant to be a way  to extend the capabilities of a VA synth by create new waveforms for its "Oscillator", not the same concept of samplesets you find on a ROMpler or a workstation (or "synths" derived from them). Also the NSE is designed with that approach in mind, imo.

title: RE: Wave 2 Sample Editor
post_content: There is no need to connect your Wave2 to your computer in order to generate the nsmp3 file for your sample. So, all 92 keys shown in the software can be covered or attributed as root - outside that range it would be necessary to prepare your audiofile within Audacity, e.g. in order to get it streched up or down. As far as I see.

title: Arp RND Group behavior
post_content: If you "group" two layers and you group a Arpeggiator set to random, should both layers play the same 'random' notes or different ones?I was trying to build a patch where the layers were acting like two oscillators on a synth so I could get a nice subby layer 2 to my FM layer 1, but then I realized that both layers are playing completely different notes than each other.I understand 'conceptually' why this is - The group function simply makes both layers do the same thing, it's not necessarily one 'arp' controlling both layers, its two arps set to the same settings.Do you think this is how it should work? Can you think of any way where both layers would do the same set of random steps?

title: RE: Arp RND Group behavior
post_content: I tested this as well and It appears that each keystroke on each layer starts on a different note, so random it is indeed. I don't think this use case was considered in development, and the design is probably why the vibrato doesn't sync across layers either.-dj

title: Wave 2 OS Update?
post_content: There are just a couple of minor things that I was hoping for on an NW2 update.  The synth has been out almost a year and I really hope Nord sees its way clear to have another update which would:1. Improve the EQ Drive Algorithm, giving it more power and scope.2. Allow all layers to by in sync when using Vibrato.3. Implement Midi Soft Thru.I know that Clavia has nothing to do with this forum, but I do think they come on from time to time to see what their customers need.  Here's hoping!-dj

title: RE: Wave 2 OS Update?
post_content: My wishlist is the following:1. Tune up the filter drive so its comparable to the Nord Lead A1 and Nord Lead 4. (in present state its just wayyyy to weak.)2. Individual Vibrato settings for each layer. (useful for multitimbral and splits. ex. a lead will often need a faster vibrato than a pad)3. Make LFO act as an envelope like on Nord Lead A1 and Nord Lead 4. (this will make S/H more useful and the LFO can act as a second MOD ENV)4. Make SHAPE possible on wavetables like on Nord Lead A1. (this is a VERY powerful way to get new interesting sounds and they can be modulated unlike the static waveforms we got now)5. Lower the speed and depth on Chorale.

title: RE: Wave 2 OS Update?
post_content: I think Nord released this board way before it was ready, honestly.In all previous Nords, vibrato was a global setting right? Perhaps it wasn't tested fully when they decided to FINALLY! allow it to be a per-preset parameter. That being said, having tried 2 different Wave 2 units, the main LFO wouldn't sync across layers once the patch was saved and re-loaded later regardless of whether the layers were in multi-edit, grouped, or synced to tempo. They do not all start at the same point in their cycles, so when one layer's LFO is at the top, another may be at the bottom of its cycle. LFO is the only section with this problem -- even effects that modulate like the phaser don't do this. Some people seem to be able to get this working, but for me it was a dealbreaker along with receiving a brand new unit that was already defective the second time around and various other bugs. Hope the Wave 3 gets it right!

title: RE: Wave 2 OS Update?
post_content: I'm probably going to end up ordering a Prophet X to see if that will fill my need for a single board for synth and samples. Won't have any of these issues, and the interface is about as logically laid out as it can be for a synth of its complexity. It also supports multi-velocity (up to 20!) samples per key and has 50 gb of user storage -- wish I could remove the factory data too like Nord allows, but still 50 gb is a lot! The way controllers are assigned is not all that far off from the morphs on a Nord either.There's a strong argument for simplicity, but I think in this case Nord didn't think it through. Nord has the Wave in a lot of artist videos but those artists don't seem to use it anywhere else, whereas Stage, Piano and Grand are commonplace. I don't think it caught on the way they were hoping it would.

title: NW2 midi multitimbrality and program changes
post_content: HelloShould get a NW2 next week.I want to use it as a multi instrument with its 4 parts on different midi channel. ON my NL4, it's easy, each part has his midi channel and i send program change on each channel since you put a whole program (patch) on each channel.NW2 works differently as a program is a a combination of up to 4 layers, you can not save individual layer like being a patch on itself.  I need to know where should i sent my program change? on the the global channel or on the first layer? If its on the global channel, i need 5 channels (one global for PC, and 4 for each layer).The big downside of this system is that you need to know in advance what sound to use on each layer since you are not able to "scroll" patch on each layer, layer not being a patch (hope i 'm clear enough), i know you can copy layer but it's not ideal in this case . I wonder why Nord did not go the performance route for program combination, so we could call any program to put in a performance layer and call them by PC.I wonder if nord could allow in a firmware update that we save layers and that we could call them in a program using a PC message.

title: RE: NW2 midi multitimbrality and program changes
post_content: Hi,Please read pages 29 and 30 of the manual which clearly describes using individual layers to send and receive midi. It also describes the complete functionality of program change messages.-dj

title: RE: NW2 midi multitimbrality and program changes
post_content: DJKeys wrote:Hi,Please read pages 29 and 30 of the manual which clearly describes using individual layers to send and receive midi. It also describes the complete functionality of program change messages.-djHiThanx, already did this some days ago. When global is OFF, it does not say, at least i can not see it, if the PC message will reach the program using ,maybe, the midi channel of the first layer.

title: RE: NW2 midi multitimbrality and program changes
post_content: I read it again myself and came to the conclusion that PC messages can only be sent or received on the global channel. This would be a limitation a multi-layer midi setup for sure, as individual midi channel per layer only works when Global is disabled.-dj

title: RE: NW2 midi multitimbrality and program changes
post_content: It doesn't seem like a limitation to me. I'd just make several copies of a program and then change one layer at a time and save each patch. Then sending a sequence of program changes will appear to be only changing one layer.

title: WAVE 2 / Sound Split with external Synth
post_content: Hey People!Im asking for a Studio friend - is it possible to split the Nord Wave into:1 side own sounds from the wave1 side controlling a external synth (in this case a Ketron SD-90) without the own wave sounds?Didnt get if its possible in the manual.Thank you so much in advance and have a great dayPhil

title: RE: WAVE 2 / Sound Split with external Synth
post_content: Hi Phil,I don't own a Wave 2 but as far as I understood you can splti the keyboard in up to 4 regions and assign each layer to one of these regions (english manual page 10).If you define individual MIDI channels for each layer (english manual page 32), then set Global MIDI channel to Off and set the MIDI channel of the SD-90 to one of the layer MIDI channels you should be able to control the SD-90 from the keyboard split region which has been set for that particular layer (see also english manual pages 28 to 32):LAYER MIDI CHANNELSUse the individual Layer MIDI channels on the Nord Wave 2 for individualcontrol of each Layer, both for notes and for panel parameters. Thiscan for example be used in a multitimbral setup, controlling 4 individualsound sources from a sequencer.E A Layer does not have to be active in a Program to receive MIDI,it will always respond to incoming MIDI on its MIDI Channel. Thismakes it possible to control selected Layers from the keyboard,and other Layers from other external sources.The Layer channels can also be used for sending MIDI, when the GlobalMIDI channel is set to Off. See page 32 for information on how tomake these settings.Wave 2 owners: please correct me if my assumption is wrong

title: RE: WAVE 2 / Sound Split with external Synth
post_content: Schorsch is correct, although the manual still has references above that say that Layers only receive midi.  Program changes, however, are not sent.-dj

title: RE: WAVE 2 / Sound Split with external Synth
post_content: DJKeys wrote:Schorsch is correct, although the manual still has references above that say that Layers only receive midi.  Program changes, however, are not sent.-djYes the manual is somewhat ambiguous here - it says that Layers only receive MIDI, but then it also says that Layers can be used to send MIDI if the Global Channel is disabled

title: RE: WAVE 2 / Sound Split with external Synth
post_content: Schorsch wrote:DJKeys wrote:Schorsch is correct, although the manual still has references above that say that Layers only receive midi.  Program changes, however, are not sent.-djYes the manual is somewhat ambiguous here - it says that Layers only receive MIDI, but then it also says that Layers can be used to send MIDI if the Global Channel is disabledYeah, I think they just didn't take the time to delete that paragraph when they did the update--dj

title: RE: WAVE 2 / Sound Split with external Synth
post_content: DJKeys wrote:Schorsch wrote:DJKeys wrote:Schorsch is correct, although the manual still has references above that say that Layers only receive midi.  Program changes, however, are not sent.-djYes the manual is somewhat ambiguous here - it says that Layers only receive MIDI, but then it also says that Layers can be used to send MIDI if the Global Channel is disabledYeah, I think they just didn't take the time to delete that paragraph when they did the update--djTo me they mean that when Global is disabled the NW2 will send  MIDI Notes/CCs of each Layer on its assigned channel, but the manual also says that Program Change is only sent on Global (see page 32 Program Change on/off parameter "This setting determines whether your nord Wave 2 transmits and/or receives MIDI program Change Messages,on the Global channel")

title: RE: WAVE 2 / Sound Split with external Synth
post_content: Yes, as mentioned, Program change is not send by the layers when Global is disabled. Still, a pretty flexible implementation if you want to play an external synth while have a sequencer trigger a layer or two--dj

title: RE: WAVE 2 / Sound Split with external Synth
post_content: I use the Wave2 with some Modules and enjoy sending the 4 layers via different midi channels. Only downside is you can only send clock via the master channel, which you have to deactivate to use the different channels for the layers.So another synth module is sending clock, which works but it would have been nice to use the Wave (and its tap tempo) for that, as it is my center piece.Good masterkeyboard otherwise.

title: RE: WAVE 2 / Sound Split with external Synth
post_content: kla234 wrote:Good masterkeyboard otherwise.I'm missing the possibility to turn local control off permanently.It is so annoying that it goes to default ON as soon as your turn the NW off.

title: RE: WAVE 2 / Sound Split with external Synth
post_content: alexpen wrote:kla234 wrote:Good masterkeyboard otherwise.I'm missing the possibility to turn local control off permanently.It is so annoying that it goes to default ON as soon as your turn the NW off.That's common a behaviour on most digital keyboards, to default Local = ON at startup. You can ovverride this by creating a mute patch, to recall when you want to use it only as a master.

title: RE: WAVE 2 / Sound Split with external Synth

title: Time-based effects: linked with layer volume?
post_content: hey y'allbeen using a NS3C for quite a while - in love with the thing.recently acquired a NW2, and was tinkering around a bit when I noticed something that kinda put me off.with the Stage3, time-based effects like delay and reverb have "trails" in a manner of speaking, where the volume of the effect's output isn't affected by volume changes of the pno/org/syn sections (ex: using the control pedal to affect the volume of the synth section to swell in a guitar sample for a pedal steel type sound with heavy reverb. the reverb's output doesn't change with the volume swells, it just sounds like a washy guitar swell should.)with the Wave2, it seems the output of the reverb (and delay) is intrinsically linked with the layer volume. if I try the same approach on the Wave, it sounds as if the reverb master is also being controlled by the pedal, leaving no ability to have a natural sonic overhang while adjusting the volume of a layer.I can see where this would be a desired way of functioning for certain applications, but the inverse is also true. what is this, an oversight? intentional design? not sure if there's any real fix for this aside from an OS update, or getting goofy with amp sustain.

title: RE: Time-based effects: linked with layer volume?
post_content: Hi, jcb-I also have both instruments and just reproduced this behavior.  It may be by design, as there are four layers of synth possible, and only one per panel on the NS3. This is the first time this issue has been raised, I think, so you may just want to add it to the Wishlist--dj

title: RE: Time-based effects: linked with layer volume?
post_content: This is by design, unfortunately -- yet another odd choice from Nord with the Wave2. There's a video where J3PO mentions this, along with a workaround, which if I remember correctly is to set a second duplicate layer with the same settings but with the effects 100% wet, so that if you only fade down layer 1 you will still get the reverb. The video was on morphing.

title: RE: Time-based effects: linked with layer volume?
post_content: tsss27 wrote:This is by design, unfortunately -- yet another odd choice from Nord with the Wave2. There's a video where J3PO mentions this, along with a workaround, which if I remember correctly is to set a second duplicate layer with the same settings but with the effects 100% wet, so that if you only fade down layer 1 you will still get the reverb. The video was on morphing.how funny. hope they'll reconsider that..unfortunately the workaround you've described doesn't quite go the distance - as you can't really sneak a sound in, you still end up with a full volume wet version at the start of the note. same with the decay on the release.

title: RE: Time-based effects: linked with layer volume?
post_content: jcbjcby wrote:how funny. hope they'll reconsider that..unfortunately the workaround you've described doesn't quite go the distance - as you can't really sneak a sound in, you still end up with a full volume wet version at the start of the note. same with the decay on the release.Indeed. it's not a perfect solution by any means, but it appears to be the only way to currently sort of accomplish a normal effects structure without using external gear. If I was designing this I would have put the reverb and overdrive as global effects. I can see uses for delay and the modulation effect to stay per layer, and the eq (minus drive) is useful to set individually as well, but drive and verb really do need to interact with the sound as a whole and when you set up a patch which uses multiple layers the sound can feel detached from each of its parts with the current design.

title: RE: Time-based effects: linked with layer volume?
post_content: I think this happens because the reverb is global per slot on the Nord Stage, so morphing the level comes before the effect. On the NW2, all four layers are independent, so the reverb is part of the layer itself.When you need this effect, just do it on one of the two NS3 slots instead of the Wave2.

title: RE: Time-based effects: linked with layer volume?
post_content: Just to add to this discussion - the Lead A1, which essentially has the same 4 layer/part structure and fx per layer as the Wave 2, *does* allow the delay and reverb tails you mention. Its layer volume is before the effects feed in the signal chain. I also really wish this had been carried over into the Wave 2. I’d love to think a toggle of the behaviour could be an option in a future firmware, but I wonder if we’ll ever see another W2 update actually.

title: RE: Time-based effects: linked with layer volume?
post_content: Yes this was one of the things that put me off my NW2 as well. I can think of very few scenarios where the way they implemented it is actually the desired effect. When would I ever want to lose the tail of my delay and verb when I turn down the level of a layer? It's annoying and definitely an oversight, like many other things on this board.I wish they had an option to make Delay and verb pre or post fader level.I still like the W2 a lot, but I am highly critical of some of the design choices they made. this is definitely one of them.

I have resigned myself to the fact that this instrument that I pre ordered and bought new in spring of 2020 may never see another update. title: Nord Wave funny button behaviour
post_content: Hi!After my romance with my Nord Lead 2X (I'm freaking in love that machine <3), today I got a beautiful Nord Wave in pristine condition at a great price... or that is what I thought.Most of the buttons, maybe half of the total, are behaving strange. Wen, i.e.,I try to change preset with the page buttons, I push the page up button, and the thing just ignore my command, change the preset as I expected, or just skip one or more presets. One of the weirdest behaviours, it's the mod envelope routing button, that sometimes, instead of cycle clockwise, make an step backwardsThe OS is the 2.14. Can be a bug? As I said, the machine it's in mint condition. The knobs feel tight, and button feel are just right, nothing loose or any strange noise. Not any sign of abuse, not even a minimal scratch.Any idea? I'm really liking this machine as his older brother, but this is driving me nuts.Thank you all!

title: RE: Nord Wave funny button behaviour
post_content: I won't give any advice concerning your isopropyl alcohol - I'm not experienced in that matter.The mixture of WD40 isn't the same everywhere in the world. But as it's also used as lubricant, it will certainly have residues: some oil that might attract dust.De-Oxit seems to be the name of a product - an electrical contact cleaner. If ever you'd use that contact cleaner spray, don't spray it around - that's what I think what Pablo wanted to state.In my eyes it was a good idea to first try to just press those buttons a couple of times until they worked again. No worry at all about that.

post_content: this wd40 is not a lubricant, that is a different product.edit:Interestingly this wd40 contacts cleaner is advertised to not leave residue, however a small % of amazon reviews say it did indeed leave sticky residue (!).What would a good deoxydizer that leaves no residue be? Isopropyl alcohol perhaps, maybe Pablo could shed some light?

title: RE: Nord Wave funny button behaviour
post_content: WD40 (according to en.wikipedia.org):A) according to the US Material Safety Data Sheet information, and with the CAS numbers interpreted:-   45-50% low vapor pressure aliphatic hydrocarbon (isoparaffin)-  <35% petroleum base oil (non-hazardous heavy paraffins)-  <25% aliphatic hydrocarbons (same CAS number as the first item, but flammable)-   2-3% carbon dioxide (propellant)B) The European formulation is stated according to the REACH regulations:-  60-80% hydrocarbons C9-C11 n-alkanes, iso-alkanes, cyclics <2% aromatics-  1-5% carbon dioxideC) The Australian formulation is stated:-   50-60% naphtha (petroleum), hydrotreated heavy-  <25% petroleum base oils-  <10% naphtha (petroleum), hydrodesulfurized heavy (contains: 1,2,4-trimethyl benzene, 1,3,5-trimethyl benzene, xylene, mixed isomers)-   2-4% carbon dioxideI'd say, if it's "petroleum based oil" or "hydrocarbons C9-C11", good part of it will stay and collect dust. But I'm not a technician. Just my estimation.

title: RE: Nord Wave funny button behaviour
post_content: Please understand that there is a WD40 brand product that is a contact cleaner which isnotthe lubricant you are referring to.

title: RE: Nord Wave funny button behaviour
post_content: I found a data sheet of what you probably mean: "WD40 Specialist Contactspray" - compatible with metal, plastics, rubber.

title: RE: Nord Wave funny button behaviour
post_content: I have a fair bit of experience with WD-40, not the contact cleaner, but the original "lubricant" (which is not either, by the way, it's meant to prevent water accumulation and oxidation. The lubricant component is there to help unlocking rusty or otherwise blocked mechanisms), and I would recommend you absolutely AVOID using it on anything electronic. It does leave a greasy film over the surface which will collect dust.As for contact cleaners, I have no experience with the WD-40 branded one, but I do have experience with other brands, and you have to be careful there too, because some of them are actually more similar in formulation to WD-40 (the "lubricant") in that they contain an oily component. No contact cleaner should contain oil of any sort.So you either choose a non oily contact cleaner, or you go with alcohol, which in my experience is the best cleaner ever for electronics. The only thing to be careful with is making sure that near surfaces aren't affected (discolored etc) by it. But for the electronics parts themselves, alcohol is the best.

title: Brandon Coleman Soundbank
post_content: Has anybody already looked at the new soundbank published today?  For me it seems to have much more usable and creative programs than the last released soundbank. There are some interesting musical ideas (mostly for my own private playing pleasure). For an old guy like me the sounds marked with 69.. or 1982.. and the sounds with "Tape" in the name create a lot of nostalgic feelings. But also that Brandon used more than 1 split point (e.g. in Sitar Split) makes it interesting to study the sounds and to play with them.It is very quiet in this Nord Wave Forum...AThank Youfrom my side to Nord. This nice instrument would need much more attention from Nord.Wolfgang

title: RE: Brandon Coleman Soundbank
post_content: koloman wrote:But also that Brandon used more than 1 split point (e.g. in Sitar Split) makes it interesting to study the sounds and to play with them.I would be a bit cautious here. Not to discredit him, or that what I am about to say has anything to do with hismusic, but as far as programming structure goes, his Program pack for the Stage 3 was somewhat messy to be honest. Not in terms of sounds, but in terms of set up. The impression was that he tried a bunch of different routes to get the sound he was after, but then left all those doors opened with plenty of unused or redundant stuff. Which is OK if you're programming a sound, you finally find it and then you want to save it in a patch, but it's less appropriate for learning how to program, as you say here.

For f.... sake we are close to what you would expect from a Rompler synth engine.This means that S/H (sample & hold) will only be useful for making space blips, whereas an LFO that can be triggered by envelope is much more useful. Nord Lead A1 got it.I've been a faithful fan of Nords for many years (got all Nords except G2) but with all this nerf i think that Nord Stage 3 was my last Nord.I am NOT going to buy a Nord Wave 2 just because it got 1 NEW thing, programable arpeggio, while leaving out essential stuff.Yeah i'm furious, been wanting a Nord Wave 2 ever since i got my Nord Wave 1 and every new product since then have been a nerf in the synth section.

title: RE: Nord Wave 2 introduced :)
post_content: What I'm really disappointed at is the choice of keybed and format factor.They will probably not release a desktop or rack version. Which is really disappointing as all major synth companies release them.And the gigantic weight and size that comes with a 61 keyboard with weighted action. Which is completely unnecessary for a synthesizer.What it feels like is that they forgot to make synths for synth players and instead are marketing towards organ and piano players.Which is fine, I get that. Their stage is a success. But I will probably cease buying nords. I love their sound. But they forgot about us.I could go on and on about recent synth releases with 49 keys, module and rack versions, and no weighted action.Simply, disappointing

title: RE: Nord Wave 2 introduced :)
post_content: Funny how we tend to have different perspectives! The waterfall action and five octaves makes this instrument very appealing to me. Granted, I'm not a traditional synth player, but There is a lot of potential here, depending on the some of the MIDI capabilities of this instrument to expand beyond its own sound set.I've also read on other forums about the frustrations of 4-octave keyboards from other manufacturers being limiting, particularly when trying to split the keyboard.I'm eager to dig into the user manual when it becomes available.

title: RE: Nord Wave 2 introduced :)
post_content: Spider wrote:Why do people keep saying it's a weighted action?It is a waterfall semi-weighted keyboard, which is hard to go to departing from a traditional synth action keyboard.NoDirection wrote:cambe -   8,7 kg - gigantic? - 61 keys with hammond action bad ?  -   Well I like a keyboard that I can place on a normal X keyboard stand (Nord Leads are to short) , and that do not move around while I am playing...  But different people - different views...It wouldn't be a problem if I was a keyboardist bringing only one keyboard to the stage or living roomBut I'm bringing a sequencer, drum machines, racks (Moogs, Nords etc...) and I normally use either my nord lead 4, nord wave or nord lead a1 as sole keyboard for playing the bits I do. So the added weight (4 kg compared to the nord lead a1) and length breaks my back (literally).If I had a one keyboard setup it wouldn't be a problem, but that's just not the kind of music I doBesides all that. The choice for this keybed surely contributed to the high price tag...And I know I'm not the only synth player who advocates for space-friendly synth. Soon, nord may lose the grasp they have left on the synth community...In the end I will probably end up buying the nord wave 2, but I will wait a lot to see if they release alternative formats...

title: RE: Nord Wave 2 introduced :)
post_content: Argh,Definitely the reduced LFO section is a bit of a bummer and creative loss. The two LFOs PLUS the Mod Envelope with the routing options was key to creating some really interesting textures, great for ambient pads.They should have just made the LFO a virtual menu/routing matrix thing, with cross-layer routing potential.They seem to be under-valuing how important LFO modulation is to people, people really rely on them to create subtlety and individuality in their programming, even for just random exploration and unpredictable sound captures.So, I sort of feel like, the programming coming out of this new version will always come out a bit canned.Honestly, just a menu based LFO system and problem solved. I do this with my Pamelas New Workout no problem, manage 8 LFOs out 8 separate outputs, different shapes, offsets, subdivisions.... All from one push knob navigating an LED menu,

title: RE: Nord Wave 2 introduced :)
RE: Nord Wave 2 introduced :)
post_content: Excellent move by Nord,Whilst the original was only 2 part it was still a great Synth I think this move of a 4 part Multi model will take the Wave Series to a whole new level, given each part can have its own effect chain too,think this will be capable of some awesome layers,and good that they have included the Ensemble effect from the A1,and bang on cue a new sample editor, for both this and the Stage 3Is this the first Nord to feature Sliders!I think the 5 octave keybed may appeal to more Non Nord fanboy synth players too,whilst I never had a problem with 4 octaves,I know A few live players who have turned their noses up at Nord Synths based on the omission of that extra octave,perhaps this might gain them a few more votes with Synth heads,and maybe even a new direction for the Synths in the future to have 61 keys,I do like the Waterfall keys on my Stage 3 Compact so welcome the synths being fitted with them too if this is the way Nord are going with the Synth Line.I'm Curios to hear this Chorale effect,so am looking forward to the Upcoming Namm Video Demos.Whilst its not on my immediate purchase list as I'm waiting to see/hear the Upcoming Roland Jupiter X and DSI Pro 3 first,but I'm sure it will be a future purchase,theres not much to dislike about it so far other than perhaps a lack of options with LFO mods but sure there will be workarounds like with the A1.
